question:
6 A user wants to connect their computer to a network.
(a) (i) Identify the component in the computer that is needed to access a network.

(a) The computer has a network interface card (NIC) that has a media access control (MAC) address.
(i) One purpose of the NIC is to provide the computer with a MAC address.
Describe the other purposes of the NIC.
answer:
Any two from:
• Transmit/send data to the network/devices // Receive data from the network/devices
• To allow a physical connection
• Convert network data so it can be understood by the computer
• Convert computer data to be transmitted over the network
• To be assigned an IP address

question: (a) (ii) Identify the type of address that is allocated to the component by the manufacturer, which is used to uniquely identify the device.
(a) (ii) Identify three characteristics of a MAC address.
answer:
Any three from:
• (Represented) in hexadecimal
• Numbers are separated by colons/hyphens
• Six groups of digits
• Sets of 2-digit/8-bit (hex) numbers // 48 bits // 12-digits
• Contains manufacturer ID and unique device number
• Static address // cannot be changed

question: 8.(b) Describe the characteristics of an IPv4 address.
answer:
Any two from:
• Numbers separated by dots
• Can have numbers (in any field) from 0 to 255
• 32-bit value
• Consists of 4 numbers
• xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
